entry.title: Luten Petrowsky (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1973 Luten Petrowsky (pictured) played the saxophone in a quartet that made the first record with jazz musicians from both East and West Germany?

entry.title: suing it for copyright infringement (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after Texaco accused the academic publishers suing it for copyright infringement of profiteering, the judge called it "an odd argument ... to be made by an oil company"?

entry.title: Luigi Galleani (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after Luigi Galleani was deported from the United States, his followers retaliated by carrying out a series of bomb attacks against government officials?

entry.title: Tropicana (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Tropicana was reportedly the first building in Singapore to contain nightclubs, restaurants, and a theatre?

entry.title: Sheika Scott (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in August 2021 Sheika Scott became the youngest player to score in the Costa Rican Women's Premier Division, at just 14 years old?

entry.title: red tigrina (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the newly discovered red tigrina may already be extinct?

entry.title: Emi Wong (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Emi Wong, the Hong Kong YouTuber with the most subscribers, used a carpet sweeper to do lunges and bottles of laundry detergent to do squats?

entry.title: 100 gecs tree (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the 100 gecs tree was listed as a "place of worship" on Google Maps?
